channel.title: Null items... 2 Questions!
channel.description:
1st Question ---I get a lot of null items, like allmost all skill capes show up as capes then there is couple that have the dwarf head and say null. How can I declare that item # to show up as a cape. In Item.cfg I have that item number saying cape and crap but it still shows up as a dwarf head and null
2nd Question -- If the item number for lets say " Item id: 14139 Name: Quest point cape" and I want to change the name of it, even tho I put a different name in item.cfg it still shows up Quest point cape in trade and when u hover ur mouse over it. The only time it says what I want it to say is in 2nd confirm screen in trade.
Thanks So much in advance!!!

item.title: Null items... 2 Questions!
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

To Range This:

How is my post incorrect? Explain to me how I was wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Null items... 2 Questions!
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

yuo have to change the class8 files in your client to see name changes and fix nulls. see SilentCJ’s guide in the model section for deatails

Read full topic

item.title: Null items... 2 Questions!
item.dc:creator: @Range_This Range This
item.description:
@Range_This wrote:

[quote=“GrimReapersScythe, post:5, topic:167896”]To Crazedviking:
The client is perfectly fine. The reason you see the name of the item but you see the picture of bones, is because the models, and the ints[/quote]
Sort of.

GrimReapersScythe:

depending on what type of source you are using.

100% incorrect.

Read full topic

item.title: Null items... 2 Questions!
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

To Crazedviking:
The client is perfectly fine. The reason you see the name of the item but you see the picture of bones, is because the models, and the ints, are not the same. You will just have to look at each model and fix the ints yourself. And to fix the items to the correct equipment area this is done in item4.java or item.java depending on what type of source you are using.

Read full topic

item.title: Null items... 2 Questions!
item.dc:creator: @crazedviking crazedviking
item.description:
@crazedviking wrote:

well i have a simaler problem with null items but i did notice that…well
i downloaded summon-pkz client and when i log into my server like half the items are null and cnt even equip them they say what they are but when u go to put them on it ses dwarf remains

then i downloaded silab client and i have absalutly no nulls
only thing thats difrent is its a difrent client which im not to happy with the silab client tbh because it keeps freezing but it has no nulls

also if anyone knows of a better client plz tell trying to find one for weeks now that doesnt have nulls and at least doesnt freeze a crap load

Read full topic

item.title: Null items... 2 Questions!
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

the null items is because theres something you have changed in client.java or one of your java files that has made it not work properly, but still compile.

the item names you can only change with the client, and as im guessing your using silab client, you cant do. you can change the trade name and the name displayed on shop prices but not the actual item name.

Read full topic

item.title: Null items... 2 Questions!
item.dc:creator: @2xbladex2 2xbladex2
item.description:
@2xbladex2 wrote:

Then you dont have to compact on your .java files or its wrong id#.

Read full topic
